title: Instructional Design Grand Challenges: Problem-Centered Strategic Approaches

context.prior_knowledge: Basic Instructional Design Theory and Practical Experience
context.additional_context: Course where in-service professionals apply collaborative problem-based approaches to solve complex educational issues, optimized for mobile learning environments with digital devices

learning_goals: Learners can identify and explain the five core grand challenges in instructional design.
Learners can design a process to solve complex educational problems in real work environments using a problem-centered approach.
Learners can develop collaborative strategies and sustainable implementation plans to address grand challenges.
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
